intro: Elynanthus octandrus, commonly known as the eight-flowered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pale pink. Its milky sap is a distinctive feature, containing latex that can be toxic to some animals. Elynanthus octandrus is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils.
